alert.note: Alert for East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 4:21PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Platte County through 500 PM MDT... At 421 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sibley Peak, or 24 miles north of Wheatland, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Two Moon Campground and Glendo Reservoir around 430 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 101 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.
